intro: Hybanthus denticulatus, commonly known as the toothed hybanthus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically bloom in clusters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have serrated edges, contributing to its common name. Hybanthus denticulatus is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
